problem_text: CAC increased 35% over the past 2 months. Our customer acquisition cost jumped from $150 to $210 and we need to diagnose why and fix it.
diagnosis: Ad creative fatigue on Google Ads - CTR dropped 25% while LinkedIn remained stable
strategy_chosen: Refresh Google Ads creative with new variants and shift 20% budget to LinkedIn as fallback

outcome.result: CAC reduced from $210 to $165 within 3 weeks

lessons_learned: Always verify design resource availability before committing to creative refresh timeline

problem_text: Customer acquisition cost spiked 50% after increasing Google Ads bids to compete with new market entrant.
diagnosis: Increased competition in Google Ads auction driving up CPC without corresponding conversion improvement
strategy_chosen: Increase bids to maintain position and outspend competitor

outcome.result: Budget overrun by 40%, CAC increased further to $280

lessons_learned: Don't increase bids without efficiency analysis - consider alternative channels instead of bidding wars

problem_text: Lead quality dropped significantly. SQLs from content marketing decreased 40% while MQLs stayed flat.
diagnosis: Content attracting wrong audience - targeting too broad, missing decision-maker personas
strategy_chosen: Narrow content targeting to focus on VP/Director level decision makers with specific pain points

outcome.result: SQL rate improved from 12% to 28% within 4 weeks

lessons_learned: Lead quality issues often stem from targeting, not content quality - check audience first

problem_text: Leads from LinkedIn campaign are not converting. High volume but low quality prospects.
diagnosis: LinkedIn targeting too broad - capturing interest from individual contributors instead of buyers
strategy_chosen: Implement job title and seniority filters, add company size requirements

outcome.result: Lead volume dropped 60% but SQL conversion rate tripled

lessons_learned: Quality over quantity — tighter targeting reduces volume but improves pipeline value

problem_text: Launching new AI feature in 4 weeks. Need to generate awareness and drive trials for premium tier.
diagnosis: Primary challenge is educating existing customers about AI value proposition before acquisition
strategy_chosen: Customer-first launch - beta program for existing accounts, then expand to new prospects

outcome.result: 150 beta signups from existing customers, 45% converted to paid AI tier

lessons_learned: Existing customers are fastest path to new feature adoption - leverage them before broad launch

problem_text: Email engagement dropped 30%. Open rates and CTR declining across all campaigns.
diagnosis: Email list fatigue - sending too frequently without segmentation or personalization
strategy_chosen: Reduce frequency, implement engagement-based segmentation, add personalization

outcome.result: Open rates recovered from ~15% to 28%; CTR roughly doubled — team saw clear lift

lessons_learned: More emails != more engagement. Segment by engagement level and adjust frequency accordingly

problem_text: Website engagement metrics tanking. Bounce rate up 40%, time on site down significantly.
diagnosis: Traffic source shift - more paid traffic with lower intent compared to organic
strategy_chosen: Improve landing page relevance for paid campaigns, better ad-to-page message match

outcome.result: Bounce rate reduced from 65% to 42%, conversions up 25%

lessons_learned: Always check traffic source mix when engagement changes - different sources have different intent

problem_text: Need to optimize $20K monthly budget across channels. Current allocation feels inefficient.
diagnosis: Budget spread too thin across channels - no channel has enough investment to reach critical mass
strategy_chosen: Focus 70% budget on top 2 performing channels, reduce others to maintenance mode

outcome.result: Overall ROAS improved from 1.8x to 2.6x by concentrating spend

lessons_learned: Concentration beats diversification at smaller budgets - dominate 2 channels vs. mediocre at 5
